q14.question: WHY DOES JOHNNY BUY THE BIGGEST SUITCASE?
q14.answer: ['To put the stolen racetrack loot in']
q14.recall: Johnny buys the biggest suitcase because he plans to use it to carry the stolen cash from the racecourse hold-up.
q14.vectordb: The reason Johnny buys the biggest suitcase is to carry the racetrack loot. He stuffs the $2 million in cash into the suitcase and plans to take it with him to Boston to escape town. However, the airport officials refuse to let him carry the large suitcase on the plane, so he reluctantly checks it in for luggage. Unfortunately, on the airport runway, the suitcase falls off a luggage truck and breaks open, scattering the money in all directions. Johnny and Fay attempt to escape from the airport but are unable to hail a taxi.
q14.hybrid: Johnny buys the biggest suitcase because he plans to use it to carry the stolen cash from the racecourse hold-up.
